meanings.definition: The state or quality of being capable of germination.
meanings.sent1: The germinesses of the seeds were evident as they started to sprout.
meanings.sent2: The farmer carefully checked the germinesses of each seed before planting.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with excitement as the students observed the germinesses of their bean plants.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a canvas of colorful germinesses, each seed bringing new life to the soil.
meanings.sent5: The magic of spring lies in the germinesses of flowers blooming everywhere.

meanings.definition: The process of sprouting or developing into a new plant.
meanings.sent1: After a few days, the germinesses of the seeds could be seen peeking through the soil.
meanings.sent2: The germinesses of the acorn eventually grew into a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome joked that he had special powers to speed up the germinesses of the plants.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline transformed with the germinesses of new saplings planted along the streets.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's heart swelled with pride at the successful germinesses of the rare orchids.

meanings.definition: The ability to produce new growth or life.
meanings.sent1: The soil's rich nutrients supported the germinesses of the seeds, allowing them to thrive.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was a carpet of green, thanks to the germinesses of countless seeds.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter in the park seemed to fuel the germinesses of the flowers around them.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, the moonlight whispered secrets to the germinesses of the plants.
meanings.sent5: The old gardener marveled at the resilience of nature's germinesses, even in harsh conditions.
